Text: Manson-Guise Engine:  There is a hot side and a cold side to the engine.

<Text: Manson-Guise Engine:  Providing there is a large enough temperature difference between the two sides the engine will run.>

 triplet:<Manson-Guise Engine
4:
--------------------
<Text: Manson-Guise Engine:  The Manson-Guise engine is probably the simplest type of hot air engines having only a single con-rod, with a displacer piston and power piston that move at the same time.>
Triplets:<Manson-Guise
5:
--------------------
Text: Manson-Guise Engine:  Manson-Guise engines seem to be fairly unique in the fact that they can run in either direction (flywheel can run clockwise or anti-clockwise).
Triplets:<Manson-Guise engine
